page.title: 19A Family
page.content: We came to Islip 20 years ago,when I first started teaching after leaving the army,at the age of 45.There are six of us in the family,but our older three children are now all married with their own children,and live away.Only my wife and I and our youngest son are at home.I am the headteacher of Dr South's School,my wife works as secretary in a child cancer research establishment in the Old Radcliffe and is a District and Parish Councillor,and our son is a Countryside Assistant with the Oxford City Council.Our oldest daughter is a social worker,and the younger an archaeologist.Both are married to teachers in Comprehensive Schools.Our older son makes furniture in Devon. Until we came to Islip we had lived most of our lives in the Far East where I was with the Gurkhas and my wife was a Ceylon tea planter's daughter.
